title: Ol' Dirty Bastard
summary: Russell Tyrone Jones (November 15, 1968 â€“ November 13, 2004),[5] better known by his stage name Ol' Dirty Bastard (often abbreviated as ODB), was an American rapper. He was one of the founding members of the Wu-Tang Clan, a rap group primarily from Staten Island, New York City, which rose to mainstream prominence with its 1993 debut album Enter the Wu-Tang (36 Chambers).[6][4]
